id: bigtech:fungus could be the insecticide of the future:2026-02-01T12:00:13.000Z
title: Fungus could be the insecticide of the future
author: Elizabeth Rayne
summary_long: Exterminators keep getting calls for a reason. Wood-devouring insects, such as beetles, termites, and carpenter ants, are constantly chewing through walls or infecting trees and breaking them down. The fight against these insects usually involved noxious insecticides; but now, at least some of them can be eliminated using a certain species of fungus. Infestations of bark beetles are the bane of spruce trees. Source: arstechnica.com. Date: 2026-02-01. Why it matters: outline likely impact on technology, business, or society. What’s next: note near-term developments or signals to watch.

id: bigtech:you need to listen to m83s icy postrock record dead cities r:2026-02-01T18:00:00.000Z
title: You need to listen to M83’s icy post-rock record Dead Cities, Red Seas & Lost Ghosts
author: Terrence O’Brien
summary_long: New York City got hit with a hell of a snowstorm last week. And, inevitably, when I'm watching the snow fall, wandering the oddly quiet streets after dark, people hiding inside and staying warm, I put on M83's sophomore record, Dead Cities, Red Seas & Lost Ghosts. Before Nicolas Fromageau left the band and Anthony Gonzalez embraced traditional pop song structures, saxophone solos, and teen angst, M83 released two albums of mostly instrumental music. The self-titled debut album is kind of forgettable, but the second one finds the French duo taking inspiration from the repetitive bombast of Mogwai and Godspeed You! Source: www.theverge.com. Date: 2026-02-01. Why it matters: outline likely impact on technology, business, or society. What’s next: note near-term developments or signals to watch.

id: space:countdown underway for critical moon rocket fueling test mon:2026-02-01T21:04:45.000Z
title: Countdown underway for critical moon rocket fueling test Monday
author: William Harwood
summary_long: Braving rare sub-freezing temperatures, Kennedy Space Center workers pressed ahead with a dress-rehearsal countdown Sunday, readying NASA’s huge SLS rocket for a critical fueling test Monday to clear the way for launch on a flight to send four astronauts on a flight around the moon. The countdown began Saturday evening and will continue through the start of a simulated launch window opening at 9 p.m. EST Monday. The test started two days late because of predicted arctic weather along Florida’s Space Coast. Source: spaceflightnow.com. Date: 2026-02-01. Why it matters: outline likely impact on technology, business, or society. What’s next: note near-term developments or signals to watch.

id: consumer:indonesia is lifting its ban on grok but with some condition:2026-02-01T17:53:05.000Z
title: Indonesia is lifting its ban on Grok, but with some conditions
author: Jackson Chen
summary_long: Grok is once again available in Indonesia, after the country lifted its ban on the AI chatbot that was seen generating millions of sexualized deepfakes, thousands of which included children. The country's Ministry of Communication and Digital Affairs released a statement earlier today, which said X is allowed to resume service in Indonesia but will be subject to monitoring for any future violations. According to the Indonesian government agency, X provided a letter that detailed several implemented measures that prevent the misuse of its Grok chatbot. Alexander Sabar, the ministry’s director general of digital space supervision, said in the statement that the agency will test the new measures on an ongoing basis and will ban Grok again if it's found spreading illegal content or violating the country's laws regarding children. Source: www.engadget.com. Date: 2026-02-01. Why it matters: outline likely impact on technology, business, or society. What’s next: note near-term developments or signals to watch.

id: space:live coverage spacex to launch 25 starlink satellites on fal:2026-02-01T21:28:12.000Z
title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch 25 Starlink satellites on Falcon 9 rocket from Vandenberg SFB
author: Will Robinson-Smith
summary_long: SpaceX is kicking off the month of February with a Monday morning Falcon 9 rocket launch from Vandenberg Space Force Base. The Starlink 17-32 mission will add another 25 broadband internet satellites to the growing low Earth orbit constellation. Prior to liftoff there were more than 9,600 satellites on orbit, according to statistics maintained by expert orbital tracker and astronomer, Jonathan McDowell. Liftoff from Space Launch Complex 4 East is scheduled during a window that opens at 7:38 a.m. Source: spaceflightnow.com. Date: 2026-02-01. Why it matters: outline likely impact on technology, business, or society. What’s next: note near-term developments or signals to watch.

id: consumer:apples online store now lets you build a new mac exactly the:2026-02-01T19:04:30.000Z
title: Apple's online store now lets you build a new Mac exactly the way you want
author: Jackson Chen
summary_long: Just like buying a new iPhone through Apple's online store, you now select each spec of your new Mac device when purchasing through the website. As first spotted by MacWorld, Apple updated its online configuration tool for purchasing a Mac. Compared to the previous design that allowed you to pick between several prebuilt options, the new configurator lets you choose one spec after another instead. It's not a major difference compared to choosing between preconfigured options, but interested buyers have more customization since they can select the color, display, chip, memory, storage and even power adapter. Source: www.engadget.com. Date: 2026-02-01. Why it matters: outline likely impact on technology, business, or society. What’s next: note near-term developments or signals to watch.
